title: Population of regions in England in 2018
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of inhabitants (in millions) for 9 number of Regions.
The maximum Number of inhabitants (in millions) 9.13 is found at Region South East and the minimum is found at North East where Region is 2.66.
The highest Region South East has 6.47 more Number of inhabitants (in millions) than the lowest Region North East.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Region in the x axis and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in the y axis.
Region South East has the highest Number of inhabitants (in millions) and North East has the lowest Number of inhabitants (in millions).
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of inhabitants (in millions) for 9 number of Regions.
The maximum Number of inhabitants (in millions) 9.13 is found at Region South East and the minimum is found at North East where Region is 2.66.
The highest Region South East has 6.47 more Number of inhabitants (in millions) than the lowest Region North East.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of inhabitants (in millions) for 9 number of Regions.
The Number of inhabitants (in millions) is highest at Region South East and lowest at Region North East.
The highest value at Region South East is 3.43x times more than the lowest value at North East.
The Region South East has the highest Number of inhabitants (in millions), followed by London, and North West. Down to the Region North East which is the lowest.
The average Number of inhabitants (in millions) in all 9 Regions is 6.21.
Summing up the values of all Regions, we get total 55.92.
